description.raw:
This is in preparation for supporting nested models.

Since we started manipulating links in the model editor, we've been relying on this hierarchy:

~~~ 
world > model > link > visual
~~~

So whenever we hit a visual, if we want to manipulate the model in which it is contained, we use `GetRootVisual` and for the link we'd do `GetParent`. But as we begin supporting more deeply nested visuals, we want to have more flexibility to get ancestors in different levels and easily support hierarchies such as:

~~~ 
world > model > ... > model > link > visual
~~~

In summary, we now have these functions: 

![ancestors.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1543323319-ancestors.png)

The new functions are being used in the model manipulator and model snap tools and shouldn't change their current behaviour.

title.raw: Add functions to get a visual's ancestors according to depth
